intro: Lourea australasica, commonly known as the Australian lourea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and satinwood trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in woodland and heathland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
